channel.title: Resetting my computer
channel.description:
Hey all you crazy cats
I lost the disk that came with my computer to reset it, so is there any other way I can get a download or something somewhere, to reset everything on my computer?
P.S - And for the weiners who act like they give a shit about the stuff on my computer, yes I did backup what I want to keep.

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Read the options given on the boot screen and press the correct key. Most companies include a ‘pre-installed’ system formatting option.

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Press F5 on the screen of your computer manufacturing company’s logo comes up. There it should say like esc = boot menu, ect.

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

I used the windows restore program on my computer and restored it to a week before the fuck up I did.

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:4, topic:310769”][quote author=IceTICKER link=topic=407232.msg3007839#msg3007839 date=1256533250]
Restart your computer, press F5 and it will say some settings it will have a reboot option.
[/quote]I’ve never heard of that… But, no, you press F5 when it first starts up or the second screen.

Also, I’m not positive on this, but doesn’t Windows allow you create a new disk or is that just a backup disk with your data? Anywho, you can always torrent/down an OS and burn it (Try Windows 7), or get it from a friend.[/quote]I don’t have near enough RAM for windows 7, I have around 490 mb of RAM. Lol

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“IceTICKER, post:2, topic:310769”]Restart your computer, press F5 and it will say some settings it will have a reboot option.[/quote]I’ve never heard of that… But, no, you press F5 when it first starts up or the second screen.

Also, I’m not positive on this, but doesn’t Windows allow you create a new disk or is that just a backup disk with your data? Anywho, you can always torrent/down an OS and burn it (Try Windows 7), or get it from a friend.

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @ChaosPkers ChaosPkers
item.description:
@ChaosPkers wrote:

Um, on which screen exactly do I press f5? Just on the main log in, or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Resetting my computer
item.dc:creator: @IceTICKER IceTICKER
item.description:
@IceTICKER wrote:

Restart your computer, press F5 and it will say some settings it will have a reboot option.

Read full topic
